So we would spend seven weeks every summer on the Cal Pash River at camp, which had a huge effect
on the rest of my life. I mean, going into the Marine Corps was like going to camp.
You join the infantry, going to camp. You got active. So you did that every year
for like until you were how old? Until I was 14 and then Don Sutton, the family that owned
the camp that had, like I said, my dad went to that camp. He had two sons and nobody wanted
to take the camp over. So they basically shut the camp down, but every June, we have a reunion
with all the guys at camp wall, the tool, the sad thing is, is like I'm one of the gungest
of the reunion guys. And we go back every June, but being at camp with the counselors and you know,
they had a big effect on me as a kid growing up of like, I mean, you sat at tables. They taught
you, you know, manners, how to eat, you know, how to take care of yourself, basically how to be
a Virginia. And every at the three and at the three week mark, they would take us into Lexington,
Virginia, you know, VMI's there. And then they've got the Robert E Lee tomb is there. So we would,
you know, go visit Robert E Lee. So like at the first time that at eight years old,
I remember seeing the Robert E Lee, you know, Stonewall Jackson, Virginia, all that Washington,
you know, Virginia in history is huge. And it camped, you know, you had, you know, mandatory,
like nap time, you know, after lunch, you'd come back and it was like reading, reading, laying
in a rack, kind of an event. So, you could bring a book, you could write letters home,
the letter writing really didn't go very well. I think my mom still has the first letter I wrote.
And it was like, dear mom and dad having a good jud. And that was it. You know what I mean. And
but yeah, it, it, that, that aspect of, of growing up and seeing mentorship of like the counselors
that came into the camp and they mentored us at, you know, at a very early age and seeing kind of,
like, what right looked like for growing into becoming a man was a, was a huge huge aspect.
